Okay this part is easy to understand, but what do you build into the board =
to make the sweep linear.=A0 I think you talked about a sweep chip before.=
=A0 Is there a "linear sweep chip" that you install?




__________________=
______________
From: purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...>
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, June 28, 2009 12:58:52 PM
Subject: [EVP-I=
TC] Re: Simple FM receiver





Sweep is making the radio tune across the b=
and, the modes are random, linear or manual. Random jumps arounds around th=
e band-randomly, the idea being that the entities would comtrol the sweep b=
y affecting the white noise transistor, and they did say they do that. Line=
ar is a smooth sweep up, then back down the band, the entities seem to have=
 an easier time tracking the linear sweep. Manual is done by hand on a chea=
py radio with a tuning knob, it's easier wiht a radio that has a tuning kno=
b that does the half turn from one end of the band to the other. 

When I f=
irst started using linear mode, I couldn't hear any of the usual voices, th=
en all the sudden, I could hear it. So I'm uncertain if it's the brain that=
 has to adjust, of what if you have to create/allow the possiblity? I used =
to use radnom exclusivley, and that worked well, now I get litte with rando=
m mode. 

I use linear now becuase it's much easier to get the circuit to w=
ork. Random can be finicky, as you're trying to get random pulses to be amp=
lified, and passed through the circuit.

Frank-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ ...> wrote:
>
> How does one know how t=
o pick a certain sweep mode?=A0 Is that just a range of stations the chip s=
weeps through?=A0 If so, how does one incorporate any certain sweep?
> 
> 
=
> 
>

> From: purplespacefriend <purp=
lealiengirl@ ...>

 There's alot of steps invloved, like first you need a tuner--a voltage tun=
able radio. Then you have to decide what sweep modes you wants, Then whethe=
r or not you'll use an echo chamber, or need line outputs to record from. T=
hen, what kind of board it'll be on, and last build a cabinet. 
> 
> Frank
=
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ ...> wrot=
e:
> >
> > Frank, Would you please send me the circuitry schematic for buil=
ding your box?=A0 My son said he would build one for me but since I am tota=
lly clueless as to what he needs to accomplish this I need your input.=A0 I=
 have seen the ideas and info bantered about in this discussion group but I=
 don't know what to send my son=A0because you are always tweaking the desig=
n and sending new information to the group.=A0 If you would send me exactly=
 what me needs and the schematic I would be so grateful.=A0 -Elaine
> >
